confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at approximately 14:50 local time on 26 November 2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and around 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,000 units with about 4,800 residents; 7 of the 8 blocks were engulfed in flames.
Scaffolding made of bamboo, installed for maintenance work, was present and reportedly helped spread the fire.

timeline.event: Fire outbreak at 14:50 in Taiâ€¯Po highâ€‘rise apartment complex.
Fire classified as level 5 by Hongâ€¯Kong fire authorities.
